metadata.title: RBI Grade B - All General Awareness Practice Sets
metadata.description: Comprehensive collection of practice sets for General Awareness

metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 1
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
Only one option is correct
Recommended time: 20 minutes
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: According to the IBC data released in August 2025, how many companies have been successfully resolved under the framework as of March 31, 2025?
questions.explanation: As of March 31, 2025, a total of 1,194 companies have been successfully resolved under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) framework, enabling creditors to realize an amount of ₹3.89 lakh crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules, which new class of companies was enabled for fast-track merger procedure through the amendment on 4th September, 2025?

options.B: A holding company and its subsidiary where the transferor is a listed company
options.C: Any two or more Section 8 companies
options.D: Two or more unlisted companies which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans, debentures or deposits
options.E: A foreign company merging with an unrelated Indian company

questions.explanation: The CAA Rules were amended on 4th September, 2025, to include additional classes for fast-track merger. One of these new classes is 'Two or more unlisted companies (other than section 8 companies) which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans, debentures or deposits'.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In March 2025, India strengthened its global trade and diplomatic ties on two separate fronts. Which of the following statements correctly identifies these two key international developments?

options.A: Signed a Free Trade Agreement with the UK and joined the RCEP.
options.B: Signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union and witnessed the expansion of BRICS membership.
options.C: Initiated the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) and signed a Bilateral Investment Treaty with the USA.
options.D: Signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union and was admitted as the 39th member of the OECD.
options.E: Narrowed the trade deficit with China and hosted the G20 Summit.

questions.explanation: The current affairs content for March 2025 specifically mentions two distinct events: India signing a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union, and the expansion of the BRICS group to include new members like Saudi Arabia and the UAE.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the rate of the "Health and Education Cess on income-tax" to be levied on the amount of income-tax and surcharge?
questions.explanation: As per sub-section (11) of Section 2 of the Finance Bill, the amount of income-tax and surcharge shall be further increased by an additional surcharge called the 'Health and Education Cess on income-tax', calculated at the rate of four per cent. (Page 31)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The National Quantum Mission, launched to foster R&D in quantum technology, was allocated a specific fund. What was the total outlay for this mission and over how many years will it be implemented?
questions.explanation: The Government of India launched the National Quantum Mission in September 2025 with a total financial allocation of ₹6,000 crore to be implemented over a period of 5 years.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the assessment year 2025-26, what is the surcharge rate on income tax for a firm or local authority whose total income exceeds one crore rupees?
questions.explanation: In the case of every firm or local authority with a total income exceeding one crore rupees, the income tax shall be increased by a surcharge calculated at the rate of twelve per cent. (Page 13, 85, 86)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In May 2025, India's economy achieved a significant milestone by surpassing which country to become the world's 3rd largest with a GDP of $4.5 trillion?
questions.explanation: The current affairs content for May 2025 states that India became the world's 3rd largest economy with a GDP of $4.5 trillion, surpassing Japan.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The time limit for issuing a notice for income escaping assessment under Section 148 has been revised. A notice can be issued if up to five years and three months have elapsed, provided the escaped income is likely to amount to or exceed a certain threshold. What is this threshold?
questions.explanation: The substituted Section 149(1)(b) allows for a notice to be issued if three years and three months, but not more than five years and three months, have elapsed from the end of the relevant assessment year, provided the Assessing Officer has evidence that the income chargeable to tax which has escaped assessment amounts to or is likely to amount to fifty lakh rupees or more. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The eligibility period for claiming tax deductions on certain incomes for units in an International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) involved in leasing aircraft or ships under Section 80LA has been extended. What is the new deadline for commencement of operations for such units?
questions.explanation: Clause 19 amends Section 80LA(2)(d) by extending the deadline for commencement of operation for a unit in an IFSC leasing aircraft or ships from 31st March 2025 to 31st March 2030. (Page 43, Page 149)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to section 80CCD, what is the maximum annual deduction allowed to a parent or guardian for contributions made to the National Pension Scheme account of a minor?
questions.explanation: Clause 17 inserts a new proviso in section 80CCD(1B) to allow a deduction for payment or deposit made to the account of a minor under the pension scheme, subject to a maximum aggregate amount of fifty thousand rupees. (Page 42, Page 148)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above in 2023-24, according to the annual Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) report?
questions.explanation: The unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above has steadily declined from 6 per cent in 2017-18 to 3.2 per cent in 2023-24, as per the 2023-24 annual PLFS report. (Page 76)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on NITI Aayog's analysis, approximately how many crore people are estimated to have escaped multidimensional poverty between 2015-16 and 2019-21?
questions.explanation: The analysis shows a sharp decline in multidimensional poverty, with an estimated 13.5 crore Indians escaping it between 2015-16 and 2019-21, putting India on track to achieve SDG Target 1.2 well ahead of 2030. (Page 265)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) in its meeting held from August 4-6, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) unanimously voted to keep the policy repo rate under the liquidity adjustment facility (LAF) unchanged at 5.50 per cent.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the income tax rate for total income from Rs. 4,00,001 to Rs. 8,00,000 for individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) for the assessment year 2026-27?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 115BAC specifies a tax rate of 5 per cent for total income ranging from Rs. 4,00,001 to Rs. 8,00,000, effective from the assessment year 2026-27. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Several key appointments were made to lead financial institutions between late 2024 and mid-2025. Which of the following leadership appointments occurred in the first quarter of 2025 (Jan-Mar)?

options.A: Sanjay Malhotra took charge as the Governor of RBI.
options.B: CS Setty was appointed as the new Chairman of State Bank of India.
options.C: Atul Bheda was appointed as the Chairman of SEBI.
options.D: Madhabi Puri Buch was reappointed as Chairperson of SEBI.
options.E: Dinesh Kumar Khara was reappointed as Chairman of State Bank of India.

questions.explanation: Atul Bheda was appointed as the Chairman of SEBI in February 2025. Sanjay Malhotra's appointment was in Dec 2024 (though he took charge in Jan 2025, the appointment was earlier). CS Setty's appointment was in Sep 2025, Madhabi Puri Buch's reappointment was in May 2025, and Dinesh Khara's reappointment was in Nov 2024. Therefore, only Atul Bheda's appointment falls within the Q1 2025 timeframe.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected Gross NPA (GNPA) ratio for Scheduled Commercial Banks by September 2024 if the macroeconomic environment deteriorates into a severe stress scenario?
questions.explanation: Macro stress tests indicate that if the macroeconomic environment worsens to a severe stress scenario, the GNPA ratio for all SCBs may rise from 3.2 per cent to 4.4 per cent by September 2024. (Page 91)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What amount of Gross Market Borrowing does the Government of India plan for the second half of FY 2025-26, including issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds?
questions.explanation: The Government of India plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore in the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26 (H2: FY 2025-26) through dated securities, which includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Effective from the assessment year beginning 1st April 2026, what will be the income tax rate for individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) for the income slab of Rs. 8,00,001 to Rs. 12,00,000?
questions.explanation: Clause 24 amends Section 115BAC, introducing a new tax table. For the income slab from Rs. 8,00,001 to Rs. 12,00,000, the applicable rate of tax is 10 per cent. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India and ADB signed a $125 million loan agreement in September 2025 to upgrade urban services in which Indian state?
questions.explanation: The Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a $125 million loan agreement to enhance urban livability and bolster climate resilience in six district headquarters and Guwahati, in the State of Assam.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Following the Monetary Policy Committee meeting in February 2025, what was the revised policy repo rate?
questions.explanation: The MPC decided to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points from 6.50 per cent to 6.25 per cent in the February 2025 meeting. (Page 112, 115)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To enhance credit availability for small and marginal farmers, the RBI has increased the limit for collateral-free agriculture loans. What is the newly enhanced limit per borrower?
questions.explanation: Taking into account the rise in agricultural input costs and overall inflation since the last revision in 2019, it has been decided to increase the limit for collateral-free agriculture loans from ₹1.6 lakh to ₹2 lakh per borrower. (Page 13, 22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In the October 2024 Statement on Developmental and Regulatory Policies, what was the announced enhancement for the UPI Lite wallet limit?
questions.explanation: To encourage wider adoption of UPI, it was decided to increase the UPI Lite wallet limit from ₹2,000 to ₹5,000 and the per-transaction limit from ₹500 to ₹1,000. (Pages 14, 22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The compounded quarterly growth rate (CQGR) of India's deseasonalised quarterly GDP was higher in the post-pandemic period (Q3FY21 - Q4FY24) compared to the pre-pandemic period (Q1FY12 - Q4FY20). What were these respective growth rates?
questions.explanation: Analysis reveals that the compounded quarterly growth rate (CQGR) of deseasonalised quarterly GDP was greater in the period Q3 FY21 – Q4 FY24 at 1.9% than the CQGR of 1.5% in the pre-pandemic period of Q1 FY12 – Q4 FY20. (Table I.1, page 63)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Finance Bill proposes a change in the TDS rate for income in respect of investment in a securitisation trust under Section 194LBC. What is the new uniform TDS rate?
questions.explanation: Clause 63 amends section 194LBC to substitute the varying rates of 25% or 30% with a uniform TDS rate of ten per cent. (Page 57, Page 168)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its February 2025 meeting, what was the policy repo rate set by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC)?
questions.explanation: The MPC unanimously voted to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points from 6.50 per cent to 6.25 per cent in its February 2025 meeting. This was the first rate reduction since February 2023. (Page 89, 112, 115)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During the monetary tightening cycle from May 2022 to March 2024, by how many basis points did the weighted average domestic term deposit rate (WADTDR) on outstanding term deposits increase?
questions.explanation: In the tightening cycle from May 2022 to March 2024, the WADTDR on outstanding term deposits increased by 185 basis points. During the same period, the policy repo rate was increased by 250 bps. (Page 115, Table III.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The second advance estimates (SAE) placed real GDP growth for Q3:2023-24 at what level, outpacing consensus forecasts?
questions.explanation: Real GDP growth for Q3:2023-24 was placed at 8.4 per cent, underpinned by strong investment and an improvement in private consumption. (Page 11)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During the monetary policy tightening period from May 2022 to December 2024, the repo rate increased by 250 basis points. In this context, which statement accurately compares the monetary policy transmission to fresh deposits and fresh rupee loans between Public Sector Banks (PSBs) and Private Sector Banks (PVBs)?

options.A: Transmission to fresh deposit rates was higher in PVBs, while transmission to fresh lending rates was higher in PSBs.
options.B: PSBs demonstrated higher transmission than PVBs in both fresh deposit rates and fresh lending rates.
options.C: PVBs showed stronger transmission than PSBs across both fresh deposit and fresh lending rates.
options.D: Transmission to fresh lending rates was higher in PVBs, while transmission to fresh deposit rates was higher in PSBs.
options.E: Both bank groups experienced identical transmission in fresh deposit rates, but PSBs had a lower transmission in fresh lending rates.

questions.explanation: During the May 2022 to December 2024 period, Public Sector Banks (PSBs) showed a higher transmission of the policy rate hike. The Weighted Average Domestic Term Deposit Rate (WADTDR) on fresh deposits increased by 274 bps for PSBs compared to 214 bps for Private Sector Banks (PVBs). Similarly, the Weighted Average Lending Rate (WALR) on fresh rupee loans increased by 177 bps for PSBs versus 163 bps for PVBs. (Page 62, Charts IV.11 and IV.12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the purposes of the Direct Tax Vivad se Vishwas Scheme, 2024, what is the 'specified date' on which appeals or applications must be pending?
questions.explanation: Section 89(n) of the scheme defines 'specified date' as the 22nd day of July, 2024. (Page 83)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the estimated growth rate for the industrial sector in FY25?
questions.explanation: The industrial sector is estimated to grow by 6.2 per cent in FY25, supported by strong growth in construction and electricity. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 2
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
Only one option is correct
Recommended time: 20 minutes
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: The Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from August 1, 2025, redefined the threshold of 'substantial interest' from ₹5 lakh to what new amount?
questions.explanation: One of the key amendments in the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, is redefining the threshold of ‘substantial interest’ from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, revising a limit that had remained unchanged since 1968.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Amid a healthy economic performance, what was the total value of capital formation facilitated by primary markets in FY24?
questions.explanation: Primary markets remained robust during FY24, facilitating capital formation of ₹10.9 lakh crore, compared to ₹9.3 lakh crore in FY23. (page 110)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a significant diplomatic and economic development in September 2025, India signed a Bilateral Investment Agreement (BIA) with which country?
questions.explanation: The Government of the Republic of India and the Government of the State of Israel signed a Bilateral Investment Agreement (BIA) in New Delhi on 8th September 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the first advance estimates, what is India's real GDP growth estimated to be for FY25?
questions.explanation: As per the first advance estimates released by the National Statistical Office (MoSPI), the real gross domestic product (GDP) growth for FY25 is estimated to be 6.4 per cent. (Page 56, Para 1.22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the financial year 2024-25, what was the average spread of the Weighted Average Call Rate (WACR) over the policy repo rate?
questions.explanation: The weighted average call rate (WACR), on an average, traded 6 bps above the policy repo rate during 2024-25. (Page 31, 80)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The tax benefit for eligible start-ups under Section 80-IAC has been extended. The benefit will now be available to eligible start-ups incorporated before which date?
questions.explanation: Clause 18 amends the Explanation in Section 80-IAC, extending the date of incorporation for eligible start-ups from '2025' to '2030', meaning the benefit is available to start-ups incorporated before 1st April, 2030. (Page 43, Page 148)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as of September 2024, reaching a multi-year low?
questions.explanation: The gross non-performing assets (GNPA) ratio of scheduled commercial banks fell to a multi-year low of 2.6 per cent in September 2024, buoyed by falling slippages and higher write-offs. (Page 55)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In August 2025, after years of holding out, India decided to join which major regional trade pact after specific modifications were made to the agreement's terms?
questions.explanation: In a significant policy shift, India signed the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) in August 2025. This decision came after certain modifications were incorporated into the trade deal, addressing India's earlier concerns.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In February 2025, the IRDAI increased the Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) limit in the insurance sector. What was the new limit, and what was the previous limit from which it was increased?
questions.explanation: The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) implemented a major reform in February 2025 by increasing the FDI limit in the insurance sector to 74% from the previous cap of 49%.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the Union Budget 2025-26 presented in January 2025, what fiscal deficit target was set as a percentage of GDP for the financial year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The Union Budget 2025-26, presented by the Finance Minister, set the fiscal deficit target for the financial year 2025-26 at 4.9% of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its meeting from June 4-6, 2025, what was the policy repo rate decided by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC)?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) decided to reduce the policy repo rate under the liquidity adjustment facility (LAF) by 50 basis points to 5.50 per cent with immediate effect. (Page 7)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The revised prudential norms for the investment portfolio of commercial banks, issued on September 12, 2023, introduced several key modifications. Which of the following was NOT one of these modifications?

options.A: Principle-based classification of investment portfolio into HTM, AFS, and FVTPL categories.
options.B: Removal of the 90-day ceiling on the holding period for the 'Held for Trading' (HFT) category.
options.C: Removal of the ceiling on investments in the 'Held to Maturity' (HTM) category.
options.D: Mandatory inclusion of all Statutory Liquidity Ratio (SLR) securities in the HTM category.
options.E: Symmetric recognition of gains/losses for investments under AFS and FVTPL categories.

questions.explanation: The revised Directions included the inclusion of non-statutory liquidity ratio (SLR) securities in the HTM category, subject to fulfilling certain conditions. It did not mandate the inclusion of all SLR securities. Other mentioned modifications are correct as per the report. (Page 145, para VI.27)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Following the Monetary Policy Committee meeting in February 2025, what was the new policy repo rate set at?
questions.explanation: In its February 2025 meeting, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) unanimously decided to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it down from 6.50 per cent to 6.25 per cent. (Page 8)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Finance (No. 2) Bill, 2024, introduced a new scheme for the resolution of direct tax disputes. What is this scheme named?

options.B: The Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme, 2024
options.D: The Direct Tax Dispute Resolution Scheme, 2024
options.E: The Direct Tax Kar Samadhan Scheme, 2024

questions.explanation: Chapter IV of the Finance (No. 2) Bill, 2024, is titled 'THE DIRECT TAX VIVAD SE VISHWAS SCHEME, 2024'. Section 88(1) states, 'This Scheme may be called the Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme, 2024.' (Page 80)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) of the Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFC) sector as of September 2023?
questions.explanation: The CRAR of NBFCs stood at 27.6 per cent in September 2023, which is well above the regulatory minimum of 15 per cent, indicating substantial capital buffers. (Page 19, 71)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In May 2025, India achieved a major economic milestone by surpassing Japan to become the world's third-largest economy. What was India's approximate GDP size at that point?
questions.explanation: In May 2025, India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) reached $4.5 trillion, which led to it surpassing Japan and becoming the third-largest economy in the world.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Household Consumption Expenditure Survey (HCES) 2022-23, by what percentage did the Monthly Per Capita Consumption Expenditure (MPCE) in rural areas increase in real terms over 2011-12?
questions.explanation: The HCES 2022-23 results showed that the Monthly Per Capita Consumption Expenditure (MPCE) in rural areas increased in real terms by 40 per cent over 2011-12. (page 220)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the findings of the sixth round of India's remittances survey for 2023-24, which state emerged as the top recipient of inward remittances?
questions.explanation: According to the state-wise destination of remittances in 2023-24, Maharashtra received the largest share at 20.5 per cent, followed by Kerala with a 19.7 per cent share. (Page 100, Table 2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the assessment year beginning on April 1, 2025, under the revised new tax regime, which income tax rate is applicable for the income slab from Rs. 7,00,001 to Rs. 10,00,000?
questions.explanation: According to the new table under section 115BAC for the assessment year 2025-26, the tax rate for the income slab from Rs. 7,00,001 to Rs. 10,00,000 is 10 per cent. (Page 52)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
As per the monthly accounts of the Government of India published in September 2025, which of the following figures for the period up to August 2025 is correctly matched? 
I. Total Receipts as a percentage of BE 2025-26: 36.7% 
II. Total Expenditure as a percentage of BE 2025-26: 30.9% 
III. Capital Account Expenditure: ₹4,31,579 crore
questions.explanation: Statement I is correct: Total Receipts were ₹12,82,709 crore, which is 36.7% of BE 2025-26. Statement II is incorrect: Total Expenditure was ₹18,80,862 crore, which is 37.1% of BE 2025-26 (the 30.9% figure was for the period upto July 2025). Statement III is correct: Capital Account Expenditure was ₹4,31,579 crore. Thus, I and III are correct.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Market Borrowing planned by the Government of India for the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The Government of India, in consultation with the RBI, finalized its borrowing programme for the second half of FY 2025-26 and planned to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore through dated securities, including ₹10,000 crore via Sovereign Green Bonds.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Identify the correct set of provisions from the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from August 1, 2025.

options.A: Redefinition of 'substantial interest' threshold to ₹50 lakh, increasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 12 years, and allowing PSBs to transfer unclaimed shares to IEPF.
options.B: Redefinition of 'substantial interest' threshold to ₹2 crore, increasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 10 years, and allowing PSBs to transfer unclaimed shares to IEPF.
options.C: Mandatory merger of all cooperative banks with PSBs, redefining 'substantial interest' to ₹1 crore, and setting director tenures to 8 years.
options.D: Redefinition of 'substantial interest' threshold to ₹2 crore, decreasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 6 years, and disallowing transfer of unclaimed shares to IEPF.
options.E: Increasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 10 years, allowing PSBs to set their own 'substantial interest' thresholds, and mandatory transfer of unclaimed shares to the RBI.

questions.explanation: Key provisions of the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, effective from August 1, 2025, include redefining the 'substantial interest' threshold from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, increasing the maximum tenure of cooperative bank directors to 10 years, and permitting PSBs to transfer unclaimed shares, interest, and bond amounts to the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the fiscal deficit of the Union Government as a percentage of GDP in FY24, according to provisional actuals?
questions.explanation: The fiscal deficit of the Union Government was brought down from 6.4 per cent of GDP in FY23 to 5.6 per cent of GDP in FY24, as per provisional actuals data. (page 64)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Non-Performing Asset (GNPA) ratio for Scheduled Commercial Banks as of March 2025?
questions.explanation: According to the performance metrics of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs), the Gross NPA ratio reached a multi-decadal low of 2.3 per cent as of March 2025. (Source: Page 55, Chart 1.44)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs amended the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules in September 2025 to expand the scope of fast track mergers. Which of the following merger scenarios is NOT permitted under this new expanded scope?

options.A: Between two or more unlisted companies meeting prescribed loan thresholds.
options.B: Between a holding company and its subsidiary where the transferor company is a listed company.
options.C: Between two or more subsidiaries of the same holding company where the transferor is unlisted.
options.D: Between a holding company and its subsidiaries where the transferor company is unlisted.
options.E: All of the above are permitted.

questions.explanation: The amendment on September 4th, 2025, included mergers between a holding company and subsidiary companies but explicitly excluded cases where the transferor company is a listed company. Therefore, a merger where the transferor is a listed company is not permitted under the fast track procedure.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The TDS rate for e-commerce operators under section 194-O has been revised. What is the new rate of tax deduction on the gross amount of sales or services?
questions.explanation: The amendment to section 194-O substitutes the words 'one per cent.' with '0.1 per cent.' for the TDS rate applicable to e-commerce operators, effective from October 1, 2024. (Page 73, 201)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The rate of tax deduction at source (TDS) on income by way of commission or brokerage under Section 194H has been reduced. What is the new effective rate from October 1, 2024?
questions.explanation: As per the amendment to section 194H, the words 'five per cent.' have been substituted with 'two per cent.', reducing the TDS rate on commission or brokerage. (Page 72)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
In a move to attract more capital inflows, the RBI revised the interest rate ceilings on FCNR(B) deposits in December 2024. Which of the following statements regarding this revision is/are correct?
1. The ceiling for deposits with a maturity of 1 year to less than 3 years has been increased to overnight ARR plus 400 bps.
2. The ceiling for deposits with a maturity of 3 to 5 years has been increased to overnight ARR plus 500 bps.
3. The relaxation in interest rate ceilings is available until March 31, 2025.
questions.explanation: All three statements are correct. Banks are permitted to raise fresh FCNR(B) deposits of 1 year to less than 3 years maturity at rates not exceeding overnight Alternative Reference Rate (ARR) plus 400 bps (up from 250 bps). For deposits of 3 to 5 years maturity, the ceiling has been increased to overnight ARR plus 500 bps (up from 350 bps). This relaxation is available till March 31, 2025. (Page 12, 21)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The definition of a 'short-term capital asset' in Section 2(42A) has been amended. With retrospective effect from July 23, 2024, what is the maximum holding period for an asset to be classified as short-term?
questions.explanation: Clause 3 of the Bill amends clause (42A) of section 2 to provide that a 'short-term capital asset' would mean a capital asset held for not more than twenty-four months immediately preceding the date of its transfer, down from thirty-six months. (Pages 33, 162)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: With reference to the financial stability indicators for banks and Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs) as of end-June 2024, which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.A: The Gross NPA ratio for banks stood at 2.7 per cent, its lowest since March 2011.
options.B: The Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for NBFCs was significantly above the regulatory threshold, standing at 26.6 per cent.
options.C: The annualized Return on Assets (RoA) for banks at 1.4 per cent was higher than the RoA for NBFCs.
options.D: The annualized slippage ratio for banks, measuring new NPA accretions, continued to decline and reached 1.3 per cent.
options.E: The Gross NPA ratio of NBFCs was 2.8 per cent, its lowest level since March 2021.

questions.explanation: Statement C is incorrect. According to the data provided, the annualized Return on Assets (RoA) for banks stood at 1.4 per cent, while the RoA for NBFCs stood at 3.2 per cent at end-June 2024. Therefore, the RoA for NBFCs was higher than that for banks. All other statements are correct based on the information in the footnote. (Page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 3
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
Only one option is correct
Recommended time: 20 minutes
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: What is the real GDP growth projected by the Reserve Bank for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank's baseline projection for real GDP growth for 2024-25 is 7.0 per cent. (Page 18, Table I.3)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In the December 2023 MPC meeting, the real GDP growth projection for 2023-24 was revised upwards to what percentage?
questions.explanation: At the time of the December 2023 meeting, the projection of real GDP growth for 2023-24 was revised up to 7.0 per cent. (Page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To ease potential liquidity stress, the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) was reduced by 50 bps in December 2024. What is the new CRR as a percentage of NDTL?
questions.explanation: The CRR of banks was reduced by 50 bps in two equal tranches of 25 bps each, bringing it down to 4.0 per cent of Net Demand and Time Liabilities (NDTL) effective from the fortnight beginning December 28, 2024. (Page 86, 112, 285)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the assessment year beginning on April 1, 2025, what is the income tax rate for an individual under the new tax regime for total income up to Rs. 3,00,000?
questions.explanation: As per the revised tax slab table for the assessment year beginning on or after April 1, 2025, under section 115BAC, the rate of tax for total income up to Rs. 3,00,000 is Nil. (Page 52)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: India's weightage in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index (MSCI-EMI) increased significantly by November 2024. What was the new weightage?
questions.explanation: The Indian equity market outperformed its emerging market peers, leading to an increase in India’s weightage in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index (MSCI-EMI) to 19.9 per cent in November 2024. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of March 2025, the ownership share of Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) in NSE-listed companies surpassed that of Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs). What were their respective ownership shares?
questions.explanation: As of March 2025, FPI ownership in NSE-listed companies touched a decadal low at 17.5%, while DIIs' share surpassed it, reaching 18.1%. (Source: Page 41, Chart 1.27d)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect on 1st August 2025, the threshold for 'substantial interest' has been redefined from ₹5 lakh to what revised amount?
questions.explanation: A key amendment in the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from 1st August 2025, was to redefine the threshold of ‘substantial interest’ from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, revising a limit that had remained unchanged since 1968.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Throughout the financial year 2023-24, what was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC)?
questions.explanation: Considering the growth-inflation dynamics, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent during 2023-24. (Page 29, Para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the targeted production capacity of Green Hydrogen per annum under the National Green Hydrogen Mission?
questions.explanation: The National Green Hydrogen Mission aims to achieve a production capacity of about five million metric tonnes per annum of Green Hydrogen. (Page 290, Para 10.42)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Considering India's international engagements in 2025, including advocating for MDB reforms at the G20, proposing a BRICS payment system, and signing the RCEP agreement, what is the most coherent strategic objective reflected by these actions?

options.A: A complete shift away from Western-led financial institutions towards Eastern alliances.
options.B: An isolationist policy focused on building self-reliant economic structures.
options.C: A pursuit of greater strategic autonomy by diversifying economic partnerships and reforming global governance.
options.D: Prioritizing regional trade over global trade to reduce supply chain vulnerabilities.
options.E: A diplomatic strategy focused solely on increasing India's voting power at the IMF and World Bank.

questions.explanation: These diverse actions collectively point towards a nuanced foreign policy. Proposing a BRICS payment system and advocating for MDB reforms aim to create alternatives and reform existing structures. Signing RCEP indicates engaging with key trade blocs. This multi-pronged approach reflects a desire for greater strategic autonomy and a more influential role in a multipolar world, rather than a complete shift or isolationism.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To combat rising inflation, the Reserve Bank of India increased the repo rate in its February 2025 monetary policy review. By how many basis points was the rate increased?
questions.explanation: In February 2025, the RBI increased the repo rate by 25 basis points, taking it from 6.50% to 6.75%, as a measure to control inflation.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the value of the Reserve Bank of India’s Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index) as of March 2024?
questions.explanation: The Reserve Bank of India’s Financial Inclusion Index (FI-Index), which captures the extent of financial inclusion across the country, stood at 64.2 in March 2024, an increase from 60.1 in March 2023. (Page 24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the first advance estimates for 2024-25, what was the estimated positive contribution of net exports to the overall GDP growth?
questions.explanation: The bulletin states that on the external front for FY 2024-25, exports grew by 5.9 per cent while imports contracted by 1.3 per cent. This dynamic enabled net exports to contribute positively to GDP growth by 1.7 percentage points. (Page 16)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Effective from April 1, 2025, the standard deduction for salaried individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) has been revised. What is the new deduction amount?
questions.explanation: A proviso has been inserted in section 16(ia) stating that for income-tax computed under section 115BAC, the deduction shall be 'seventy-five thousand rupees' instead of 'fifty thousand rupees'. (Page 39)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In December 2024, the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) for banks was reduced to what percentage of Net Demand and Time Liabilities (NDTL)?
questions.explanation: To ease potential liquidity stress, the CRR of banks was reduced by 50 bps to 4.0 per cent of NDTL in December 2024. (Page 112, 116)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In March 2025, India signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with which major economic bloc, marking a significant milestone in its trade policy?
questions.explanation: India and the European Union signed a landmark Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement in March 2025, aiming to significantly boost bilateral trade and investment.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the analysis of distributional characteristics of household inflation expectations, which of the following measures were found to be significant with a negative sign, suggesting their utility in predicting one year ahead inflation?

options.E: Standard deviation, Interquartile range, and Skewness

questions.explanation: The model's estimates suggest that measures of dispersion like standard deviation and interquartile range, as well as skewness, are significant with a negative sign in predicting one year ahead inflation, whereas median and mean were found to be not significant. (Page 16, Table I.1.1)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its December 2024 meeting, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) announced a cut in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR). What was the quantum of the cut and the expected liquidity infusion?

options.A: Cut to 4.25% from 4.5%, infusing ₹0.96 lakh crore
options.B: Cut to 4.0% from 4.5%, infusing ₹1.16 lakh crore
options.C: Cut to 3.75% from 4.25%, infusing ₹1.25 lakh crore
options.D: Cut to 4.0% from 4.25%, infusing ₹1.00 lakh crore
options.E: Cut to 3.5% from 4.0%, infusing ₹1.36 lakh crore

questions.explanation: In its December 2024 meeting, the MPC announced a cut in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) to 4 per cent of the net demand and time liabilities (NDTL) from 4.5 per cent. The decision is expected to infuse around ₹1.16 lakh crore liquidity into the banking system. (Pages 81-82)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: How did the median projection for the end-period repo rate for 2024-25 from the Survey of Professional Forecasters (SPF) compare with the actual policy rate maintained by the MPC as of the October 2024 report?

options.A: SPF projected a 25 bps higher rate.
options.B: SPF projected a 25 bps lower rate.
options.C: SPF projection was identical to the MPC's rate.
options.D: SPF projected a 50 bps lower rate.
options.E: SPF did not provide a repo rate projection.

questions.explanation: Table I.3 shows the median projection from the SPF for the end-period repo rate for 2024-25 is 6.25%. The MPC maintained the rate at 6.50%. Therefore, the SPF projected a rate 25 bps lower than the prevailing rate.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's Current Account Deficit (CAD) as a percentage of GDP in Q2 of FY25?
questions.explanation: India's current account deficit (CAD) moderated slightly to 1.2 per cent of GDP in Q2 of FY25, against 1.3 per cent of the GDP recorded in Q2 of FY24. (Page 149, Para 3.44)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The gross non-performing assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks declined to what level in June 2024?
questions.explanation: The asset quality of Scheduled Commercial Banks improved, with the overall gross non-performing assets (NPA) ratio declining to 2.7 per cent in June 2024 from 3.7 per cent a year ago.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Nobel Prize in Economics for 2024 was awarded to Claudia Goldin for her extensive research in which specific area?

options.E: The role of banks in financial crises

questions.explanation: Claudia Goldin was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics in October 2024 for her significant contributions and research on the gender gap in the labor market.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which statement is INCORRECT regarding the government's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26 as announced in September 2025?

options.A: The gross market borrowing is planned at ₹6.77 lakh crore through 22 weekly auctions.
options.B: The borrowing includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
options.C: The largest share of borrowing (28.4%) will be under the 10-year security maturity.
options.D: Weekly borrowing through Treasury Bills in Q3 is expected to be ₹19,000 crore for 13 weeks.
options.E: The government reserves the right to exercise a greenshoe option of up to ₹5,000 crore against each security.

questions.explanation: All statements are correct except for the greenshoe option amount. The government will reserve the right to exercise a greenshoe option to retain an additional subscription of up to ₹2,000 crore, not ₹5,000 crore, against each of the securities indicated.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The RBI revised the definition of 'Bulk Deposits' for Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) in October 2023. What is the new threshold for a single Rupee term deposit to be classified as a 'Bulk Deposit' for RRBs?
questions.explanation: On October 26, 2023, the Reserve Bank enhanced the bulk deposit limit for RRBs. 'Bulk Deposit' for RRBs would now mean single Rupee term deposits of ₹ one crore and above, revised from the earlier limit of '₹15 lakh and above'. (Page 146, para VI.33; Annex I, page 279)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the total amount the Government of India plans to borrow through dated securities in the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The Government of India, in consultation with the RBI, finalized its borrowing programme and plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore in the second half of FY 2025-26 through dated securities.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: A new Section 44BBD introduces a special provision for computing profits for non-residents providing services or technology for setting up electronics manufacturing in India. What percentage of the aggregate amounts received or paid is deemed to be profits and gains of such business?
questions.explanation: The new Section 44BBD(1) states that a sum equal to twenty-five per cent of the aggregate of specified amounts shall be deemed to be the profits and gains of the business of the non-resident assessee, chargeable to tax under 'Profits and gains of business or profession'. (Page 39, 145)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Considering the risk scenarios presented, a simultaneous 5% depreciation of the INR and a 10% rise in international crude oil prices above the baseline would likely increase headline inflation by approximately how many basis points?
questions.explanation: According to the risk scenarios, a 5% INR depreciation could increase inflation by around 35 bps, and a 10% rise in crude oil prices could increase it by 30 bps. The combined approximate impact would be 65 bps.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the central government's budgeted fiscal deficit to GDP ratio for the fiscal year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The document states that the central government's fiscal deficit to GDP ratio declined to 4.8 per cent in 2024-25 and is budgeted to moderate further to 4.4 per cent in 2025-26. (Page 9)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged throughout 2023-24. What was this rate?
questions.explanation: Considering the growth-inflation dynamics, the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent during 2023-24. (Page 29, para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Based on the 56th GST Council meeting recommendations, which of the following statements is/are correct? 
I. GST on all individual life and health insurance policies has been exempted. 
II. The inverted duty structure for the fertilizer sector was corrected by reducing GST on Sulphuric acid from 18% to 5%. 
III. GST on buses, trucks, and ambulances was reduced from 28% to 18%.
questions.explanation: All three statements are correct. The 56th GST Council meeting exempted GST on individual life and health insurance, corrected the inverted duty structure on inputs for fertilizers like Sulphuric acid by reducing the rate to 5%, and reduced the GST on commercial vehicles like buses and trucks to 18%.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 4
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
Only one option is correct
Recommended time: 20 minutes
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee in its meetings between October 2023 and February 2024?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent through H2:2023-24 to align inflation with the target while supporting growth. (Page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a risk scenario where the Indian Rupee (INR) depreciates by 5 per cent over the baseline, what is the estimated impact on domestic inflation and GDP growth?

options.A: Inflation rises by 50 bps and GDP growth falls by 25 bps
options.B: Inflation rises by 35 bps and GDP growth rises by 25 bps
options.C: Inflation falls by 35 bps and GDP growth falls by 25 bps
options.D: Inflation rises by 25 bps and GDP growth rises by 35 bps

questions.explanation: The report's analysis on the balance of risks indicates that if the INR depreciates by 5 per cent over the baseline, inflation could rise by around 35 bps while GDP growth could benefit by around 25 bps through the trade channel. (Page 22-23)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In October 2025, how much additional tax devolution was released by the Union Government to State Governments to enable them to accelerate capital spending ahead of the festive season?
questions.explanation: On 1st October 2025, the Union Government released an additional tax devolution of ₹1,01,603 crore to State Governments to accelerate capital spending and finance development expenditure.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the total amount of gold held by the Reserve Bank of India as of March 31, 2024?
questions.explanation: As on March 31, 2024, the total gold held by the Reserve Bank was 822.10 metric tonnes, an increase from 794.63 metric tonnes on March 31, 2023. (Page 261, Para ii and Table XII.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In September 2025, the Japanese credit rating agency, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I), upgraded India's long-term sovereign credit rating to what level?
questions.explanation: Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) of Japan upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’, while retaining the “Stable” Outlook for the Indian economy.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected real GDP growth for the Indian economy for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: Taking into account various domestic economic factors, the real GDP growth for 2024-25 is projected at 7.0 per cent with risks evenly balanced. (Page 34, para I.38)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Following the Monetary Policy Committee meeting in April 2025, what was the new policy repo rate set at?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) unanimously voted to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 6.00 per cent with immediate effect. (Page 7)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 140B, what is the additional income-tax payable if an updated return is filed after the expiry of twenty-four months but before thirty-six months from the end of the relevant assessment year?
questions.explanation: A new clause (iii) is inserted in Section 140B(3) which prescribes that sixty per cent of the aggregate of tax and interest payable shall be the additional income-tax if the updated return is furnished after twenty-four months but before thirty-six months from the end of the relevant assessment year. (Page 50, 158)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The BRICS bloc underwent a significant expansion in March 2025. Based on the provided list, which of the following countries was NOT among the new members that joined the group?
questions.explanation: The expansion of BRICS in March 2025 included Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt, Ethiopia, and Iran. Argentina was not mentioned as one of the new members in the provided text.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its June 2025 monetary policy review, the RBI maintained the repo rate at 6.75%. Which of the following economic indicators from the preceding month (May 2025) likely supported this decision to hold rates steady?

options.A: Manufacturing PMI reaching 58.5, highest in 15 months

questions.explanation: The decision to hold the repo rate in June 2025 was likely influenced by the easing of Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation to 3.2% in May 2025, which suggested that inflationary pressures were moderating, reducing the immediate need for a rate hike.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the recommendations from the 56th GST Council meeting is INCORRECT?

options.A: GST on all individual life and health insurance policies is to be exempted.
options.B: The GST rate on manmade fibre is to be reduced from 18% to 5%.
options.C: A uniform GST rate of 18% is proposed for all auto parts irrespective of their HS code.
options.D: GST on small cars and motorcycles equal to or below 350cc is reduced from 28% to 18%.
options.E: The 4-tiered tax rate structure is rationalised into a 3-rate structure with rates of 5%, 18%, and 28%.

questions.explanation: The GST Council recommended rationalising the 4-tiered tax rate structure into a citizen-friendly ‘Simple Tax’ - a 2-rate structure with a Standard Rate of 18% and a Merit Rate of 5%, plus a special de-merit rate of 40%. The statement about a 3-rate structure of 5%, 18%, and 28% is incorrect.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The report notes a 'paradoxical' situation where banks simultaneously placed substantial funds under the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) while borrowing heavily from the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF). What key measure was introduced by the RBI effective December 30, 2023, to address this and improve fund management?

options.A: The spread between MSF and SDF rates was increased.
options.B: A penal charge was introduced for using both facilities on the same day.
options.C: Reversal of liquidity facilities under both SDF and MSF was permitted even on weekends and holidays.
options.D: The borrowing limit under MSF was reduced for banks using the SDF facility.
options.E: Banks were mandated to choose only one of the two facilities on any given day.

questions.explanation: To address the paradoxical situation of simultaneous high usage of both SDF and MSF and to enable better fund management, the RBI decided to allow the reversal of liquidity facilities under both SDF and MSF even during weekends and holidays, effective from December 30, 2023. (Page 113, Para III.22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a sensitivity analysis scenario involving a parallel upward shift of 250 bps in the yield curve, what would be the estimated reduction in the system-level Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) and how many foreign banks would breach the regulatory minimum of 9%?

options.A: A reduction of 77 bps in CRAR, with two foreign banks breaching the minimum.
options.B: A reduction of 114 bps in CRAR, with four foreign banks breaching the minimum.
options.C: A reduction of 115 bps in CRAR, with four foreign banks breaching the minimum.
options.D: A reduction of 318 bps in CRAR, with no banks breaching the minimum.
options.E: A reduction of 608 bps in CRAR, with all foreign banks breaching the minimum.

questions.explanation: It is assessed that a parallel upward shift of 250 bps in the yield curve on the fair-valued portfolio (AFS and FVTPL) would reduce the system-level CRAR by 114 bps. At a disaggregated level, this major shock would cause four foreign banks' CRAR to fall below the regulatory minimum of 9 per cent. (Page 97)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as of September 2024, which was noted as a 12-year low?
questions.explanation: The asset quality of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) improved significantly, with their Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio declining to a 12-year low of 2.6 per cent in September 2024. (Page 80)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To bolster depositor confidence, the government increased deposit insurance coverage in April 2025. What is the new coverage limit, and what was the total bank deposit base in India as of September 2025?
questions.explanation: In April 2025, the government raised the deposit insurance coverage from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh per depositor. This strengthened a banking sector whose total deposits grew to ₹205 lakh crore by September 2025, reflecting robust public trust.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a flagship social security scheme, surpassed how many gross enrolments as of July 2025?
questions.explanation: As per the press release from the Ministry of Finance, the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments as of July 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected real GDP growth for the financial year 2025-26 as per the April 2025 Monetary Policy Statement?
questions.explanation: Taking all factors into consideration, the real GDP growth for 2025-26 is projected at 6.5 per cent, with quarterly breakdowns of Q1 at 6.5%, Q2 at 6.7%, Q3 at 6.6%, and Q4 at 6.3%. (Page 9)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the surcharge rate on income tax for a co-operative society with a total income exceeding one crore rupees but not exceeding ten crore rupees?
questions.explanation: For every co-operative society, the surcharge on income tax is calculated at the rate of seven per cent if the total income exceeds one crore rupees but does not exceed ten crore rupees. (Page 13, 120)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India launched the PM Vishwakarma scheme in November 2024 to support traditional artisans and craftspeople. What was the total financial outlay allocated for this scheme?
questions.explanation: The PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in November 2024, was introduced with a substantial financial allocation of ₹13,000 crore to uplift traditional artisans.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As on March 22, 2024, what was the money multiplier (MM)?
questions.explanation: As on March 22, 2024, the money multiplier (MM) was 5.4, which was marginally higher than its decennial average of 5.3 (2013-14 to 2023-24). (Page 72, para II.4.11; Page 73, Table II.4.1)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In March 2025, India signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with which of the following economic blocs?
questions.explanation: After extensive negotiations, India signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union in March 2025, aiming to boost bilateral trade and investment.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What policy repo rate was maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the RBI during its meetings in the first nine months of FY25 (April-December 2024)?
questions.explanation: During the first nine months of FY25 (April 2024-December 2024), the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the RBI decided to keep the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5 per cent. (Page 81)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Economic Survey 2023-24, what was the estimated real GDP growth rate for the financial year 2024 (FY24)?
questions.explanation: The preface of the Economic Survey 2023-24 states on page 8, 'In May, we learnt that the Indian economy is estimated to have grown 8.2% in real terms in FY24.'
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the macro stress tests for credit risk, what is the projected Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks by March 2025 under a severe stress scenario?
questions.explanation: The macro stress test results project that the aggregate CRAR of 46 major banks may go down to 13.0 per cent under the severe stress scenario by March 2025, which is still above the minimum capital requirement of 9 per cent. (Page 85)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Arrange the following sectors in descending order of their share in total FDI equity inflows during H1 of FY25: 1. Computer software and hardware 2. Services Sector 3. Trading 4. Non-conventional energy
questions.explanation: In H1 of FY25, the Services sector was the largest recipient of FDI (19.1%), followed by computer software and hardware (14.1%), trading (9.1%), and non-conventional energy (7.0%). (Page 152, Para 3.51 & Chart III.15)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the official theme of the Swachhata Hi Seva (SHS) Campaign 2025, launched by the Department of Financial Services?
questions.explanation: The Department of Financial Services launched Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 (SHS 2025), a nationwide cleanliness campaign scheduled from September 17 to October 2, 2025. This year's theme is 'Swachhotsav', blending festive celebrations with cleanliness.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: By the end of March 2025, the Central Bank Digital Currency-Retail (e₹-R) pilot had been expanded to how many banks and users respectively?
questions.explanation: As at end-March 2025, the pilot program for the e₹-R segment was expanded to include 17 banks and 60 lakh users since its inception in December 2022. (Page 34)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What baseline assumption for the price of the Indian basket of crude oil was used for projections for 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The baseline assumption for crude price (Indian basket) is reduced to US$ 70 per barrel during 2025-26, as stated in the April 2025 MPR. (Page 14, Table I.2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth projected at for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: Real gross domestic product (GDP) for India is projected to grow at 6.6 per cent in 2024-25, supported by a revival in rural consumption and strong services exports. (Page 24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the RBI's OBICUS survey, what was the seasonally adjusted capacity utilisation (CU) in manufacturing firms in Q2 FY25?
questions.explanation: The RBI’s Order Books, Inventory, and Capacity Utilisation Survey (OBICUS) showed that the seasonally adjusted capacity utilisation (CU) in manufacturing firms was 74.7 per cent in Q2 FY25, which is above the long-term average of 73.8 per cent. (Page 64, Para 1.40)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 5
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
Only one option is correct
Recommended time: 20 minutes
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: What was the Net Interest Margin (NIM) of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as of March 2024?
questions.explanation: The Net Interest Margin (NIM) of SCBs remained robust at 3.6 per cent in March 2024, having moderated from its peak of 3.9 per cent in Q1 of FY24. (page 94-95)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Which of the following statements about the recommendations of the 56th GST Council meeting held in September 2025 is/are correct? 
I. It proposed a simplified 2-rate structure with a Standard Rate of 18% and a Merit Rate of 5%. 
II. GST on cement was reduced from 28% to 18%. 
III. GST on all individual life and health insurance policies was exempted to make insurance more affordable. 
IV. The de-merit rate for select goods and services was proposed to be 30%.

options.E: All I, II, III and IV

questions.explanation: The 56th GST Council approved major reforms including a 2-rate structure (18% standard, 5% merit), reduction of GST on cement from 28% to 18%, and exemption of GST on all individual life and health insurance policies. The special de-merit rate was proposed at 40%, not 30%, making statement IV incorrect.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In which month of 2024 did the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) decide to change its policy stance from 'withdrawal of accommodation' to 'neutral'?
questions.explanation: Buoyed by a well-balanced inflation-growth dynamics, the MPC unanimously decided in its October 2024 meeting to change the policy stance from withdrawal of accommodation to neutral to provide it the flexibility to monitor the progress of ongoing disinflation. (Page 114)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of July 2025, the Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a flagship social security scheme, surpassed how many total gross enrolments since its launch in 2015?
questions.explanation: According to a press release from July 2025, the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) has achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments since its launch on May 9, 2015.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The "Namo Drone Didi" scheme, with an outlay of ₹1261 Crores for 2023-24 to 2025-26, aims to provide 15,000 drones to Women Self Help Groups (SHGs). What is the percentage of the drone package cost provided as Central Financial Assistance (CFA) to the SHGs?
questions.explanation: Under the 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme, Central Financial Assistance (CFA) is provided at the rate of 80% of the cost of the drone package, up to a maximum of Rs. 8.00 lakhs, to the selected women SHGs.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: While Gross FDI inflows to India saw a significant increase in April-February 2024-25 compared to the previous year, what was the primary reason cited for the moderation in Net FDI inflows during the same period?

options.A: A sharp decline in confidence from foreign investors due to global volatility.
options.B: Increased government restrictions on foreign capital repatriation.
options.C: Higher repatriation of capital by foreign investors and increased outward investment from India.
options.D: A significant fall in services exports, reducing the available capital for investment.
options.E: The appreciation of the Indian Rupee making new investments less attractive.

questions.explanation: The document states on page 8 that 'Net FDI inflows, however, moderated during this period due to higher repatriations and outward investment, which is a sign of a mature market where foreign investors can enter and exit smoothly, reflecting positively on the Indian economy.' This indicates that the moderation was not due to negative sentiment but rather a characteristic of a maturing market. (Page 8)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the Economic Survey 2023-24, the Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) reached a 12-year low at the end of March 2024. What was this specific GNPA ratio?
questions.explanation: Page 93, paragraph 2.23 of the Economic Survey 2023-24 states, 'The gross non-performing assets (GNPA) ratio of SCBs continued its downward trend, reaching a 12-year low of 2.8 per cent at the end of March 2024 from its peak of 11.2 per cent in FY18.' This is also supported by Chart II.7a on page 94.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Finance Bill 2024 proposes a new section 194T for deduction of tax at source (TDS) on payments like salary, remuneration, or interest by a firm to its partners. What is the specified TDS rate?
questions.explanation: The newly inserted section 194T mandates that a firm responsible for paying any sum like salary, remuneration, commission, bonus, or interest to a partner shall deduct income-tax at the rate of ten per cent. (Page 73)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in November 2024 to support traditional artisans, was introduced with what initial financial allocation?
questions.explanation: The Government of India launched the PM Vishwakarma scheme in November 2024 with a total financial allocation of ₹13,000 crore to uplift traditional artisans and craftspeople.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP) has a potential of ₹6 lakh crore over FY22-FY25. What were the total monetisation receipts recorded from FY22 to FY24 against the target of ₹4.3 lakh crore for that period?
questions.explanation: The National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP) listed assets with a potential of ₹6 lakh crore for monetisation over FY22–FY25. During the period FY22-FY24, receipts worth ₹3.9 lakh crore have been recorded against a target of ₹4.3 lakh crore. (page 66)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) of Scheduled Commercial Banks stood well above the regulatory minimum in March 2024. What was this ratio?
questions.explanation: For Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs), the Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) stood at 16.8 per cent in March 2024, indicating strong capital buffers. (Page 18)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its monetary policy review of February 2025, the Reserve Bank of India increased the repo rate to combat inflation. By how many basis points was the rate increased, and what did it become?
questions.explanation: The RBI, in its February 2025 policy review, hiked the repo rate by 25 basis points as a measure to control rising inflation, taking the new policy rate to 6.75%.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as of March 2025?
questions.explanation: According to the performance indicators of SCBs, the CRAR stood at a record high of 17.3 per cent as of March 2025, up from 16.8 per cent in March 2024. (Page 55, Chart 1.44)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the net Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) inflow recorded during the period of April-November 2024?
questions.explanation: Net FDI declined significantly to US$ 0.5 billion during April-November 2024, a sharp drop from the US$ 8.5 billion recorded in the same period a year ago. This was due to a rise in repatriation and net outward FDI. (Page 43)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per a regulatory update in February 2025, the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) increased the Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) limit in the insurance sector. What is the new revised FDI limit?
questions.explanation: In February 2025, the IRDAI implemented a significant policy change by increasing the FDI limit in the Indian insurance sector from the previous 49% to a new ceiling of 74%.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What trend is anticipated in the quarterly real GDP growth rate during FY 2025-26 as per RBI's structural model estimates?

options.A: It is expected to remain constant at 7.1%.
options.B: It is projected to start at its highest point in Q1 and then moderate.
options.C: It is projected to progressively increase from Q1 to Q4.
options.D: It is expected to dip in Q2 and recover in H2.
options.E: It is projected to be volatile with no clear trend.

questions.explanation: For 2025-26, structural model estimates indicate real GDP growth with Q1 at 7.3 per cent, Q2 at 7.2 per cent, and Q3 and Q4 both at 7.0 per cent. This shows the growth rate is expected to start at its highest and then moderate through the year.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the macro stress tests conducted for Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs), how many banks were projected to potentially breach the minimum capital requirement of 9 per cent CRAR by March 2026 under the hypothetical 'adverse scenario 1'?
questions.explanation: The stress test results reveal that under 'adverse scenario 1', the aggregate CRAR of SCBs may deplete to 14.3 per cent, and four banks may breach the minimum capital requirement of 9 per cent by March 2026. (Page 90)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The COP29 climate summit, attended by 198 countries, was held in which city in November 2024?
questions.explanation: The COP29 climate summit took place in Baku, the capital city of Azerbaijan, in November 2024, where global climate change policies were discussed.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The rate of tax deduction at source (TDS) on commission on the sale of lottery tickets under section 194G has been revised. What is the new TDS rate?
questions.explanation: As per the amendment to section 194G, the words 'five per cent.' have been substituted with 'two per cent.' for TDS on commission on the sale of lottery tickets, effective from October 1, 2024. (Page 72, 199)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following was awarded the Padma Vibhushan in January 2025?
questions.explanation: The Padma Vibhushan awards for 2025 were conferred upon Vyjayanthimala Bali, Koneru Ramakrishna Rao, and Dilip Sanghvi.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the macro stress tests, what is the projected Gross NPA (GNPA) ratio for all Scheduled Commercial Banks by March 2025 in a severe stress scenario?
questions.explanation: While the GNPA ratio of all SCBs is projected to improve to 2.5 per cent by March 2025 under the baseline scenario, it may rise to 3.4 per cent if the macroeconomic environment worsens to a severe stress scenario. (Page 86)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which scheme was launched in September 2023 to provide recognition, skill upgradation, and credit support to traditional artisans and craftspeople across 18 trades?
questions.explanation: The PM Vishwakarma programme was launched in September 2023 to provide end-to-end support for traditional artisans and craftspeople working with traditional tools across 18 trades. (page 314)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to section 80CCD, what is the maximum annual deduction allowed to a parent or guardian for contributions made to a minor's account under the National Pension Scheme Vatsalya Accounts?
questions.explanation: A new proviso in section 80CCD(1B) allows a deduction for payment or deposit made to a minor's account under the pension scheme, subject to the condition that the aggregate amount of deduction shall not exceed fifty thousand rupees. (Page 42, 148)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 194LBC, what is the new uniform rate of tax to be deducted at source on income payable to a resident investor from a securitisation trust?
questions.explanation: Section 194LBC has been amended to provide a reduced uniform TDS rate of 10% on income in respect of investment in a securitisation trust, replacing the previous differential rates of 25% and 30%. (Page 57, 168)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding recent government initiatives and financial data is INCORRECT based on press releases from July-September 2025?

options.A: The Cabinet approved the Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana to be implemented in 100 districts, beginning with FY 2025-26.
options.B: As of March 31, 2025, creditors realised ₹3.89 lakh crore from 1,194 companies resolved under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC).
options.C: The Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from August 1st 2025, redefined 'substantial interest' threshold from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore.
options.D: Under the 'One State-One RRB' policy, the number of Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) in India was reduced from 43 to 28, effective from May 1st, 2025.
options.E: The Nationwide Financial Inclusion Saturation Campaign launched in July 2025 resulted in over 2.6 crore new enrollments under the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) alone.

questions.explanation: The press release on the Nationwide Financial Inclusion Saturation Campaign states that it resulted in more than 2.6 crore fresh enrollments under the three Jan Suraksha social security schemes (PMJJBY, PMSBY, and APY) combined, not just under the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) alone. All other statements are correct as per their respective press releases.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of March 31, 2024, what was the total outstanding credit from Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) to the non-conventional energy sector?
questions.explanation: The 'State of the Economy' article mentions that as of March 31, 2024, scheduled commercial banks' (SCBs') credit limits for the non-conventional energy sector stood at ₹1.19 lakh crore with a total outstanding of ₹75,251 crore. (Page 81)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: A new presumptive taxation scheme is proposed under Section 44BBD for non-residents providing technology or services for setting up an electronics manufacturing facility in India. What percentage of the aggregate amount paid or received for such services will be deemed as profits and gains?
questions.explanation: The newly inserted section 44BBD(1) specifies that a sum equal to twenty-five per cent of the aggregate amounts (paid, payable, received, or deemed to be received) shall be deemed to be the profits and gains of the non-resident's business. (Page 39)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the approximate percentage of maintainable complaints under the RBI’s Integrated Ombudsman Scheme in 2023-24 that required mediation or formal intervention from the RBI Ombudsmen?
questions.explanation: In the speech titled 'Transforming Grievance Redress: The AI Advantage', it is mentioned that nearly 57 per cent of the maintainable complaints in 2023-24 required mediation or formal intervention by the RBI Ombudsmen. (Page 8)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During 2023-24, liquidity conditions tightened, causing the average daily net absorption under the Liquidity Adjustment Facility (LAF) to moderate significantly. What was the average daily net absorption figure for 2023-24?
questions.explanation: Liquidity conditions tightened during 2023-24. The average daily net absorption under the liquidity adjustment facility (LAF) moderated to ₹485 crore during 2023-24 from ₹1.87 lakh crore in the previous year. (Page 29, para I.14)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amended Section 2(42A), the holding period for an asset to be a short-term capital asset is now twenty-four months. This amendment takes effect retrospectively. What is the effective date of this change?
questions.explanation: The notes on Clause 3, which amends Section 2(42A), explicitly state at the end, 'This amendment will take effect retrospectively from 23rd July, 2024.' This makes the new 24-month rule applicable from this specific date. (Page 162)
questions.subject: General_Awareness
